author: alexfig8
title: Awesome little polybag!
review:
I bought this set yesterday at Toys R Us in the US.  It cost $3.49 and was the only polybag set they had at the time, besides Mixels.  I was immediately drawn to it because it is rather unique and was about $1.50 cheaper than the usual polybag price of $4.99.  Now, onto the review.

Box/Instructions

Just a simple polybag.  The bag shows the set well enough, with the lift itself on the side of the road with the minifigure fixing something that we cannot see.  The instructions are just a sheet with two sides.  Nothing too complicated here.  Also, since I am from the US, the bag states it has 40 pieces, unlike the picture of the bag above.

Parts

Once again, nothing too amazing.  Another wrench is nice to have, as is the bucket the figure stands in.  I have never seen that part in gray before, only white.  The yellow wheels are useful as well, they generally only appear in construction/mining sets.

Minifigures

Just one, a fairly generic construction worker fig.  His head is newer, I believe it is from the mining subtheme of last year.  His accessories include a wrench and a small control panel, which I assume controls the lift.

The build

Pretty fast, nothing too complex as far as techniques go.  Nothing really to say about it other than fairly enjoyable.

The completed model

The final product exceeded my expectations greatly.  I assumed it would be a lot smaller, but it can actually extend kinda far.  The set is very useful in any sort of city layout, and can be paired with a lot of sets.  In fact, I've noticed many sets in the City line now include light fixtures on the outside or lamp posts.  Besides a 2010 set, there has been nothing really to repair these.  This set fills that gap nicely.  Also works well for another construction vehicle.

Overall opinion

A fantastic set, you should totally go buy it.  I'm thinking about buying another for my layouts!  Thanks for reading!

author: The_Brick_Station
title: Small, acceptable Polybag
review:
This set is overall a good polybag, and it would be useful in a city, but for playing... Well, read on.

Box/Instructions

The polybag looks okay, but it is a City set, and the City line is not famous for box art. Instructions fold out.

Parts

It has some useful pieces, such as the container on top and the 1x3 curved slopes in yellow...

Minifigures

The minifigure is awfully generic, with very easily attainable parts. It would have been nice to get a more detailed construction worker like in the LEGO Movie.

The build

The build is just meh. It looks like some sort of ATV when you look at it closely. But from a distance it looks fine for a lift.

The completed model

The minifig and model together clash okay, but as mentioned about the minifigure, it would be nice for it to include more design.

Overall opinion

Overall, this polybag is a nice little build to add to your city.

-Travis

author: Odeinoichus
title: Time for Repairs.
review:
Set #30229 Repair Lift: LEGO City Polybags are pretty much miniature additions to the larger sets. They are often just more microbuild police and fire vehicles, however there are a few nice ones that have been made in recent years. And this is one of the nicer unique ones, let’s cover why this set is one you should track down.

Pros:

  • Nice unique looking vehicle design not seen before in LEGO City Polybags.

  • Construction Worker Minifigure has a nice simple look to him. Facial print will be a big hit with fans of Breaking Bad, print will make some AFOL MOCers pretty happy.

  • Basket piece unique and has many great uses.

  • Finished model looks nice and solid, and the instructions are simple and fun.

Cons:

  • Accessories are limited, wrench not unique, and control panel for repair lift is an odd printed tile choice which looks different and not what you’d expect here.

  • Piece count on the smaller side for LEGO City Polybags.

Overall opinion

Overall while I do still recommend this set I caution you that the price per piece ratio may be slightly higher than desirable. Also the minifigure isn’t unique to this set and his print is fairly simple, while that might not be a bad thing, it does mean when you buy multiples of this you won’t get much use out of the minifigure as a clone build. Though it does mean you get a good torso for building up your City collection.

The next polybag I’m reviewing is a much more satisfying addition to your City collection though.
